citation.article-title: Streptococcus castoreus sp. nov., isolated from a beaver (Castor fiber).
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Streptococcus castoreus sp. nov.
Streptococcus castoreus (cas.to′re.us. L. masc. adj. castoreus pertaining to a beaver, from which the bacterium was originally isolated).
Cells stain Gram-positive and are cocci that occur in pairs or short chains.
Facultatively anaerobic, but grows best under anaerobic conditions.
Growth is stimulated by rich medium and CO2, but is not obligately capnophilic.
No growth on MRS at 37 °C in air, but there is growth on MRS in CO2 and in a microaerophilic atmosphere.
Growth on chocolate medium is superior to growth on blood agar.
Colonies are β-haemolytic and 0·5 mm in diameter after 24 h of incubation on horse blood agar.
Produces a strong reaction in Oxoid Strep latex with Lancefield group A antisera.
Using API test kits, acid is produced from starch, maltose, methyl β-d-glucopyranoside, pullulan and sucrose.
Acid is not produced from l-arabinose, d-arabitol, cyclodextrin, glycogen, inulin, lactose, mannitol, melezitose, melibiose, raffinose, sorbitol, tagatose or trehalose.
Aesculin is hydrolysed but hippurate is not.

Activity is detected for arginine dihydrolase, acid phosphatase, alkaline phosphatase, alanine phenylalanine proline arylamidase, leucine arylamidase, phosphoamidase, β-glucosidase and β-glucuronidase; activity for β-mannosidase is variable.

Activity is not detected for esterase C4, ester lipase C8, lipase C14, chymotrypsin, cystine arylamidase, α-fucosidase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, glycyl tryptophan arylamidase, α-mannosidase, pyroglutamic acid arylamidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, trypsin, valine arylamidase or urease.
The DNA G+C content is 37·4 mol%.
The type strain, M605815/03/2T (=CCUG 48115T=CIP 108205T), was isolated from a European beaver (Castor fiber).
